glsa.title: GD: Integer overflow
glsa.synopsis: The PNG image decoding routines in the GD library contain an integer overflow that may allow execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the program decoding a malicious PNG image.

background.p: The GD graphics library is an open source library which allows programmers to easily generate PNG, JPEG, GIF and WBMP images from many different programming languages.

description.p: infamous41md found an integer overflow in the memory allocation procedure of the GD routine that handles loading PNG image files.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to load a carefully crafted PNG image file in a GD-powered application, or send a PNG image to a web application which uses GD PNG decoding functions. This could potentially lead to execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the program loading the image.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
